Class CustomEnumSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<java.lang.Object>
      • com.scarlatti.lib.serializers.XEnumSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatVisitable

    public class CustomEnumSerializer
extends com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<java.lang.Object>
           _____                                    __
      (, /  |  /)                /)         (__/  )      /)        ,
        /---| // _ _  _  _ __  _(/ __ ___     / _ _  __ // _ _/_/_

    (_/                                   (_/
    Thursday, 11/2/2017

    A serializer happens to be the place that Jackson ALSO places the visitable service. This is probably so every object that can be written must also have the responsibility to determine how it can be visited.

    TODO could I extend a base implementation so that I wouldn't have to implement the serialize() method?

                      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator gen,

        N.B. I don't need this method, except that I need it in order to instantiate this abstract class to create a visitable object.
        Specified by:
        serialize in class com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<java.lang.Object>

      • acceptJsonFormatVisitor

        public void acceptJsonFormatVisitor(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatVisitorWrapper visitor,
                                    com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType type)
                             throws com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException
        N.B. This serializer only intended to be called to accept a visitor if the value is an enum. This is an assumption made. This method only supports being called with a CustomJsonFormatVisitor and an Enum.
        Specified by:
        acceptJsonFormatVisitor in interface com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatVisitable
        Overrides:
        acceptJsonFormatVisitor in class com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        visitor - the visitor, which is actually my CustomJsonFormatVisitor
        type - the class of the node being visited, in this case, assumed to be an enum.
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException - on mapping failure (not expected in this case).
        java.lang.RuntimeException - on being called with anything other than a CustomJsonFormatVisitor and an Enum
